Resolution_Details: On 02/09/2024 @11:30 am QSM Hamed visited Dorothy and Scott at SS to assist. QSM gave an ear and showed empathy to Sailors frustration. Sailors requested to speak with Razzle Dazzle Chef Mario which RS Tarryn  accommodated and escorted them to meet the Chef which Chef Mario explained and assisted in regards of tonight dinner in Razzle. QSM Hamed offered them Brunch in Razzle for today which they gladly accepted, Chef Mario was called and assisted with the food. Sailors also were concerning in regards of what they can eat in Bimini, QSM Hamed assisted with takinh the order and he will ensure Chef Owen is informed and service as requested will be provided on the Island.  2x ( Plain Chicken Breast no seasoning, plain white rice, corn no seasoning and water melon salad )  In regards of tomorrow dinner reservation and food we will communicate with Gunbea team and ensure meeting Sailors expectations. Sailors were very happy with the follow up appreciating the extra care and attention.

Description: 02/07/24 22.16pm HDA AC: The sailor Melisa called SS complaining about loud music  causing vibrations in their cabin coming from deck below. HDA extended apologies  and advised her  that he will check for an empty cabin in the same category and will call them back. HDA then checked and saw that there was no XL available. HDA then called the sailor back and explained that there was no XL cabin but however we had a central sea terrace which can accommodate the 3 pax and if they wish they could move in that cabin for sleeping purposes and tomorrow we check with Management with regards to solution on the room down grade as there is not other XL. Sailors then advised that they will stay in the cabin for tonight  as the music had stopped but will need someone to reach out to them to touch base on this issue in the morning. HDA informed the sailors that a report had been created and someone will reach out to them in the morning.

HDA then advised the sailor that they could not use two cabins if they wished to have a second cabin it would chargeable. However as an exception due to SN there will be loud music we offered sailor cabin 13270Z and the sailor agreed and was happy.
Resolution_Details: Sailors refused to move cabins and were offered cabin 13270Z for tonight only due to SN as the rest of the nights will be quiet. Sailor agreed and was happy.

Description:
HDA Virgil 1:10PM 2.9.24- sailor raised multiple concerns as follows: "Pubic hair on desk|

Someone else’s underwear underneath the drawers in the closet| 

Ordered 3 romance packages (and paid for them) yet one was refunded bcuz they were oversold but never even notified us.|

Ran out of bubbly very quickly at the sail away party before we could even get a single glass of it to celebrate - we had been told previously that it would be served through the entire sail away party|

All fitness classes were completely sold out within hours - there really needs to be more options so others can also join|

Safety video was difficult to load and had to watch it multiple times before we got the option to confirm we have completed it - and even after that, it still shows as incomplete|

Shake for champagne did not work for several of our crew and customer service just responded to call room service to have it delivered but we shouldn’t have to be in our room - we were told we could order anywhere on the ship|

While off the ship in Key West on cellular, we could not access details of our trip in the app. Before the trip, we weren’t required to be on the ship’s WiFi (obviously) but once the cruise began, they only way we could access our account for information is to be on ship’s WiFi but that isn’t possible in Key West.|

Many of these things were marketed to us as to how VV is better than other cruise lines but it just makes VV seem worse than other cruise ships if they don’t work - bcuz it’s a high expectation that then becomes a frustrating disappointment.|

At the Festival Stage Acts the first night at the manor - we tried to order drinks at the bar and they told us we had to order at our table. It took forever for someone to come by to take drink orders and then she was a complete jerk when we were asking about the different drinks. I finally just told her forget it, just bring us water.|

Wake brunch was a disappointing experience - especially since we were there to celebrate several birthdays. The server we had (Giovani) never introduced himself and said “no” multiple times…asked for the full menu - no, asked for croissants - no. Didn’t get our first round of mimosas until the food started coming and didn’t get a refill until we were done eating. About 1/2 way through our meal, Giovani completely disappeared. Other staff served us through the rest of the meal but never metjoned or explained why our original server disappeared."
Latest_Comment: Sailor was assured her feedback will be noted, so our leadership team can review it and take appropriate steps in order to improve the experience in the future. Bottle of bubbles was sent to sailor, thanking for their feedback.
Resolution_Details: Sailor was assured her feedback will be noted, so our leadership team can review it and take appropriate steps in order to improve the experience in the future. Bottle of bubbles was sent to sailor, thanking for their feedback.

Description: 02/09/24 06:32PM HDA AC: The sailor sent a message on the SQ that read: "What happens if the special restaurants never have an opening? Only wanted the Italian or steak house and they have been booked from start. I keep going to standby, but there are so many people in line. Do we get anything back if the dinners aren't used?//" Can you look and let us know what options are currently available for dinner? Or at least verify it's all booked out like it seems?" // "And if both of those are true, that we simply just don't get the option of eating at a premium restaurant this week even once?" HDA then extended apologies and explained to the sailor that due to high counts on this voyage the restaurants are very busy and as he did not have the system to check table availability at the restaurant he could try check with the supervisor directly if they can accommodate them at the restaurant of their choice but then again not guaranteed. The sailor then responded as follow:" You should have more options if guests have no availability options to use even one of the 2 slots?I'm already on standby zzz Will never take another virgin cruise because of this. Just make sure you note that somewhere under customer satisfaction due to lack of restaurant availability// It seems like staff is taking care of it for us. Thank you guys. HDA then replied to the sailor: "Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We will make sure your comment is shared with the leadership as we are constantly looking forward to improving the service we provide on-board our Lady Ships." The sailor then replied saying: "They ended up not being able to help. I hope you guys will be willing to give us something in exchange for the two premium meals we can't get due to you guys not having enough planned availability. So that's a total of 4 premium meals (two for two people)" HDA then informed the sailor that he will document his feedback and escalate to the Restaurant Operations Manager who will look into this and revert to them.
Resolution_Details: ROM Harry gave a courtesy call to sailors and arranged a table for dinner in The Wake for 2/9 & Extra Virgin for 2/10. Sailors were very happy and thanked ROM

Latest_Comment: Edited followup notes
Resolution_Details: Closing incident as it is resolved

Description: Last night on the Blackjack table sailor Christopher Williams was playing on the table our dealer made a mistake by taking his winning bet, Sailor Hoyos was watching the play and called it to my attention.  I said I will look at the surveillance which it was confirmed that the dealer did take the winning bet.  I came back to the table and apologized to Sailor Williams and paid him the winnings he was owed.  At this point Sailor Hoyos was saying we must pay him more money.
Latest_Comment: Sailor Williams was fine with the outcome and was pleased when he left the table, I apologized again and said we do make mistakes and we will speak to the dealer in question which we did.  Sailor Hoyos was still not pleased and kept saying we cheated and we not doing our jobs, I told Sailor Hoyos it was honest mistake and thank him for seeing it and the matter is resolved.
Resolution_Details: Sailor Hoyos then said he will make a complaint and take it further I told him we are sorry and he has the right and option to express his views on this matter and he can write a report it is with in his right to do so.  We did address the matter with the dealer which also said they were sorry and it was lack in concentration and they will be more focused in the future.

Description: 02/10/24 05:32 pm HDA AC: Sailor sent a message on the SQ that read:"Hello i would like to express my deepest disappoitment thus far on this trip. In celebration of a friend of ours she grather a few friends to take this trip with her . Suriving Cancer we were all happy to celebrate life and another birthday. We tried our best to plan everything including a beach cabana for today. Her medication and the heat was not a good mix. Our cabana was canceled unknowing to us. This was very disappointing . Expecially since, we were not notified before hand . As a medical professional i find this unprofessional and disappointment for a co//Sorry, I did not finish. I am very disappointed." HDA then replied to the sailor as follows: "Ahoy Sherma! Good evening. Thank you for reaching out to us. We are sorry to hear that you are disappointed with our service, may we kindly know more information with regards to the cabana . Did you prebook the cabana pre-voyage or you booked it while you were onboard and it when was it cancelled? Please do advise if your friend needs medical assistance so that we can advise our medical team?" The sailor then explained: "Firstly she does not me//Firstly, I would like to mention that the individual in question does not require any medical assistance. This is because she is accompanied by two medical providers during her travels. Additionally, we were able to arrange for an umbrella to ensure her comfort. However, it is with great disappointment that we discovered the cabana we had reserved and paid for in January was unexpectedly canceled without any formal notice. While we understand that system errors can occur, it had a significant impact on our experience. I must emphasize that using Virgin V was initially a pleasurable experience, but it unfortunately marred our last day. Thankfully, my friend is doing well, but as a professional in the medical field, I strongly advise that any substantial purchases be given proper attention, as it is essential to consider unforeseen circumstances where additional care and support may be required. The fact that we did not received all that was promised to us was incredibly upsetting." HDA then replied to the sailor as follows: "Thank you Sherma for sharing your detailed feedback with us. I will make sure your comment is shared with the leadership as we are constantly looking forward to improving the service we provide on-board our Lady Ships. I have created a report on this and escalated it to the Shore Things Manager to look into."
Latest_Comment: 02/10/24 06:44PM HDA AC: The sailor sent again a message that read: "I would greatly appreciate it if I could receive a response from the manager before our departure tomorrow. It would be a delightful gesture to present her with a gift from the gift shop. This entire experience and complaint revolve around ensuring a pleasant memory for her, rather than solely focusing on our payment for the cabana."
Resolution_Details: 02/10/24 ASTM Tobyn: Please see reference to SC-35428179446940771.

Description:
02/10/2024 HDA JKG. Sailor came to desk requesting for a manager. HDA asked the Sailor what may be the concern the sailor shared that he caught the dealer cheating in the casino yesterday evening. 
He addressed this yesterday evening. And apparently video footage was watched and this claim was confirmed true. 
The sailor was then refunded for that current hand he played and went on his way. 
He is concerned.
Latest_Comment:
The incident aligns with an error in payout that happened in the Casino on gaming day 02/09 (VIR #: SC-35454791617398003). The Casino Manager together with the Casino Supervisor, who handled the issue last night, spoke with the Sailor Reuben Hoyos. The Casino Manager listened to Mr. Hoyos and assured him that Casino onboard the Virgin Voyages is running a transparent business, and the words of cheating are considered as strong accusations. Genuine mistakes are happening, the right course of action was taken by the Casino Supervisor at the time of the mistake, apologies were extended to the affected player Mr. Christopher Williams. 
He mentioned that he had been appointed by his friends as an “attorney” because he was the soberest one as all of them were intoxicated. Mr. Hoyos stated that his friends were not happy with the outcome, he claimed that nobody apologized to them, and they would like to speak with the dealer. 
The Casino Manager and the Casino Supervisor apologized for the inconvenience, and they invited Mr. Hoyos and his friends to the Casino for further clarification.
(For the duration of the voyage Mr. Hoyos has no play in the casino recorded, which he confirmed.)

Description: 02/10 SSM: SSD sent an email with the comments from sailor: "There were highs and lows so far on the trip. Overall service was great and food quality for the most part was amazing. For the negative our cabin has constant creaking sound almost as if we were on board an old wooden ship. Though I understand this cruise is more on the "party" side, I was hoping there were dedicated relaxing areas (besides the spa) on the ship. Though there appears to be, it is ruined by the constant loud music at every corner of the vessel. It also makes it difficult to carry a conversation such as when at the pizza parlor. Razzel Dazzel was in line with the online comments I've read regarding sub par customer service. Which was odd because at Pink Agave was among the best I've had on any cruise line. The food there was also "meh" in comparison to food elsewhere on the ship. The main performances are only scheduled once rather than twice a night like other cruises which makes it even more difficult to schedule dining (its hard enough as it is). Lastly the ship layout is odd. I feel at times like I'm going through a corn maze. I've never seen anywhere where the men's and ladies bathroom are at opposite ends. I truly don't get the logic there and why areas are hard to get to/hidden throughout. I feel that for the most part there things can be easily fixed with training. But as of now it seems like this will be my last time at this cruse line. I appreciate the effort of providing a different take to the traditional cruise experience but there is definitely room for improvement."
Latest_Comment: 02/10 SSM: SSM spoke with Mr Juan and he expressed that the music is loud at the pizza place and he cannot have a regular conversation as he needs to raise his voice every time, SSM recommended to visit our library or our open deck 7 that is very quiet and not so busy, Mr Juan thanked the information and said he enjoyed today because most of the sailors were out of the ship and he could relax. Mr Juan expressed it was not the worse experience he had, it was the first day impression when he boarded that fill in the survey with his thoughts. Sailor mentioned that he has been in MSC, Celebrity and other cruise lines that work things differently. Mr Juan mentioned that pre voyage he was asked many different times about the reason for their cruise and he expressed it was his wife birthday and they expecting something since the question was placed many times. SSM apologized that he didnt receive a cake at the restaurant.

Description: 2/10/24 HDA CANSU - Sailor sent message through SQ: " Had a great time on the cruise. Delicious food and plenty of options. Activities were great as well. My only complaint is the quality of the "deep tissue massage", which did not feel like a deep tissue massage at all. The masseuse was nice but the massage was lack luster and did not feel deep tissue at all. For the price of the massage I expected an experience that would blow me away, but unfortunately it did not. I even expressed a need for extra attention to my upper back but the masseuse spent more time on my legs than my area of most stress. I was going to ask the masseuse to go back to my back but the massage came to and end before i had the chance. There were many delays in the massage so it did not even feel like a full 50 minute experience. I was surprised when she said it was over as the massage part felt like 30 minutes at most. Again great cruise but the massage did sour the experience a bit"
Resolution_Details: 02/11/24 10:03 HDM sailors disembarked 2024-02-11 09:39:35

Description: 02/10/24 09:00am HDA AC: The sailor stopped by sailor services to share an experience she had with the doctor when she had he Botox Treatment.  Sailors said it was the the worst experience she's ever had. she said that she has been having may Botox treatment but never one like this She  said the experience was painful, had to stop the doctor a couple of times because the pain was too much and she had teary eyes.  She went on to say the doctor did not care that she was in pain and she actually said to the Sailor  I did  not know you'd be such a big baby about it." Sailor went on to say that its not about the money , its the way the Doctor treated her especially when she was in pain and someone tell her that she is being a big baby, she felt very much offended and wanted to speak to Management about it. HDA thanked the sailor for bringing the matter to his attention and extended apologies for the bad experience and assured the sailor that he was going to document her feedback and relay it to the Spa Manger who will reach out to her as per request.
Latest_Comment: Spoke with the sailor after she made use of the thermal area and found a solution. I offered her some products which she was happy about. She thanked me and said she would be back as she wanted to purchase some more products before leaving the ship.

Description: 02/10/24 12:22 HDA AI: Sailors approached previous day to ask HDA why they dont have a champagne that was promised to them  HDA ask for more details and was told that they linked 2 cabins and they were supposed to have champagne. HDA took a look in voyage report and find their booking number on celebration bubbles and explained to them that they will receive that during the day or tomorrow day just to not put DND on door. Sailors wrote next morning to HDA colleague  via Support Queue that they were charged 105 dollars for champagne and that they were told it is for free . Colleague ask them if they had received celebration bubbles and they replayed that they didn't  colleague checked with housekeeping and that was false information. HDA made a report about this .
Latest_Comment: 02/10/24 1100hrs HDA AC: The sailors approached  SS and spoke to HDA informed him that they had done shake for champagne because they were on the bubbles list and were told by HDA Alex that they will not be charged for the shake for champagne. HDA then checked VR and saw that the sailors where on the celebration bubbles list. He then asked if they had received the bubbles on the 2nd day of the voyage of which the sailors replied that they did not. HDA then informed the sailors that he would investigate on this and revert to them. Upon checking with Manoj DM, he advised HDA that the sailors did receive  the bubbles in the cabin since second day, they were expecting something more expensive one and they aware aware about it. HDA then reverted to the sailor Nicole on SQ with a message that read: "Ahoy Nicola! Good Morning Arthur here from sailor services We spoke earlier regarding the bottle of bubbles that was charged on your account. Upon checking with the bar and Housekeeping they confirmed that there was a bottle of bubbles sent on the second day to your cabin which you are entitled to have and was not charged on your account. However since you had another bottle through shake for champagne that one is chargeable and hence why it is still on your account. I hope this helps." The sailor then responded to HDA:"Thanks for your message!! We spoke to housekeeping regarding the sparkling wine which had arrived and we weren’t aware what this was, so that answers that question- thank you!! However, we were informed yesterday that we could shake for champagne and it wouldn’t be chargeable and now we are $105 down when we wouldn’t have chosen to do that if we hadn’t been told we could." HDA then replied to the sailor with a message that read: "Thanks Nicola for the information, kindly remind me the name of the person you spoke to again regarding this free bottle of champagne so that we can verify with them?" Sailor read message but did not  reply.
Resolution_Details: No further action is required until sailors come to SS desks

Description: Feb 11 th at 09:00 Sailors asked RSA to speak with Rockstar Manager in regards to heir overall experience.
Resolution_Details: RSM met the Sailors in the suite and Sailor Marilyn shared her overall feedback about the Rockstar experience. Starting from dining the Sailor shared there is just no priority at all, she was expecting that upon arriving in the restaurants there would be a line or even a sign to let them know they are checking-in the right place for Rockstars, but just keeping it free for them to jump in front of the line and push over to be checked-in is just embarrassing. The Sailor mentioned we can fix it easily with a sign or a person to be guiding the Sailors right there. She had spoken to several people that agreed with her (about 15 Sailors) and some mentioned they are just not using this “perk” as it makes no sense.  Regarding the prioritized access to bookable events, the Sailor reported again that it is inexistent. All events she attended to at the Red Room and The Manor, none of the staff offered them priority, took them from the line or even allowed them to go first. The Sailor mentioned she asked a couple of times if Rockstars shouldn’t enter first for the events to which she was told no.  The Sailor also brought to RSM’s attention how is the service in Bimini, and according to her words it is a “joke”. There is no secluded area for the Rockstars apart from the 8-9 am window. Sailor mentioned she noticed that is the time where managers are around, so it works. But from when they leave till the end of the day, any Sailor with a red band can use the Retreat area as there is no control from the beach area. Sailors shared on how other Sailors with a red band were saying “oh we will stay here as they don’t care”, “we were told by security no one comes here to check”, “there are no umbrellas on that side so we were told we could stay here”. The Sailor indeed reported yesterday a big group of red bands Sailors smoking and making noise, but according to her it took too long for someone to show up.  She informed RSM that she is a travel agent and now she cannot sell us anymore for the Rockstars quarters. There is just no value for money if we don’t polish the services and the points she brought to our attention. She mentioned this same feedback is coming from her clients as well, and she really wants us to develop as it’s good for both sides. The Sailor is coming back on March 6th in a Sea Terrace to compare services.  RSM extended apologies for the Sailors and clarified to her how the perks go for dining and bookable events, the Sailor was understanding and very polite, however, she advised that it just never happed to her or to any Rockstar she spoke with.  RSM thanked her for her feedback and offered $200 FVC as they are coming back in a few weeks. RSM advised he will follow up with the team in regard to the bookable events priority and escalate her feedback about dining priority. The Sailors were very thankful.

Sailor Lewis shared his frustration with the email by saying "The email says you booked an ADA cabin, but we didn't". RSM informed the Sailors that this was the cabin asigned to their booking, therefore they were previously contacted to be made aware of the cabin features. The Sailor Lewis also had a problem to connect in VV app as his last name was inserted in MXP as "Jr." with an special character. Sailor then reported to be frustrated with the miscommunication happening at the terminal by the crew and started pointing that we should train them better. Sailors said as Mega Rockstars they were told they could embark at 1:30 pm, they were here a couple of weeks before and embarkation was completely messed up, so they didn't want to go through all that again. RSM extended apologies and reconfirmed they would emabrk at 1:45pm together with him.

Description:
Q: Welcome Sailor! How did you find coming aboard?, A: 2
Q: Cleanliness of the terminal?, A: 5
Q: Luggage handling?, A: 1
Q: Time it took to get onboard?, A: 4
Q: Not finished? Tell us everything!, A: Had a problem with the porter. Didn’t get his name but Marva at the door helped to set things straight. He basically didn’t tell us anything about what would need to happen next, what we were doing, etc. when asked whether we could check a grocery bag he said “open” i opened the bag and he said shortly “you don’t have to show me!” WELL WTF AM I SUPPOSED TO DO! HERE I WAS THINKING YOU DIDNT SPEAK ENGLISH THE AMOUNT OF INSTRUCTION YOU’VE GIVEN ME. Infuriating. We realized through gestures we needed to group our bags together and that it was in fact okay to check the bag in we. Just needed to tie together. But you couldn’t say that bro before snapping? Da fuq?
Latest_Comment: 02/12/24 11:13 HDM bottle and note sent to the cabin to apologize
Resolution_Details: 02/12/24 11:13 HDM bottle and note sent to the cabin to apologize

Description:
Q: How was your dining experience?, A: 3
Q: Menu choices?, A: 1
Q: Service?, A: 4
Q: Knowledge of the crew?, A: 4
Q: Not finished? Tell us everything!, A: We went to the Super Bowl showing - should have been more food options.  Other cruise lines have options
Latest_Comment: QSM will meet Sailor during Brunch In The Wake to assist. We will provide the outcome after seeing Michelle.
Resolution_Details: On 02/12/2024 @09:15 am QSM Hamed met with Michelle and Kenneth while having Brunch in The Wake. Michelle was referring to the red room and stated that in addition to the mix nuts and popcorn she would suggest to have a set up of finger food and dipping sauce like what she had in the past with other lines. QSM Hamed thanked Michelle for her valuable feedback and explained  that we do have food options available during Super Bowl in other locations like Social club and The Athletic club However we will take her valuable feedback into consideration for our future events. QSM offered assistance with any of the dinner reservations or if there is any other concerns. Sailors stated that everything else is great so far and they do appreciate very much the management quick follow up. Food and service will be closely monitored. QSM will follow up on Sailors dining experience through the voyage to ensure they are having a great experience .

Description:
Q: Welcome Sailor! How did you find coming aboard?, A: 1
Q: Service?, A: 4
Q: Cleanliness of the terminal?, A: 4
Q: Check in process?, A: 1
Q: Not finished? Tell us everything!, A: It’s hot. The AC is barely cooling the room down. The internet isn’t working and kicked me off. It won’t connect and the bed is unbelievably uncomfortable. The check in line at security was a fiasco. I got pulled aside for no good reason. My bag was gone through three times. Nobody told me what they were looking for. nothing was found and yet the two backpacks scanned before mine weren’t even gone through. I think whatever they thought was in my backpack was really in one of the bags before mine. Great I really feel safe now.  I hate this trip so far.
Latest_Comment: DM met the sailor in the cabin and apologized for the inconvenience. As per sailor AC is working fine, but they were expecting more cold .Also CH added additional comforter on the bed to make it more softer, sailor appreciated for the effort. As a gesture of apology a bottle of bubbles was delivered to the cabin from SS and sailor thanked for the assistance. Sailor also mentioned the CH doing a good job and he is comfortable with HK.
Resolution_Details: 02/12/24 12:03 HDM note and bottle sent - HSKP is aware of cabin concerns and are working on it // nothing further unless sailors approach

Description:
Gouerish Gopal Naik
The incident involved a sailor choking on a piece of steak at a table of 6. The server, noticing the situation at 10 pm, promptly approached and offered assistance, assessing if medical attention was required. The sailor went to the washroom, accompanied by the server, and returned after a brief moment. The server provided water, and the sailor assured he was fine.
Resolution_Details: The server then informed the restaurant supervisor, who promptly approached the table, ensuring the sailor's well-being. The sailor reassured the supervisor but, simultaneously, same sailor's wife blamed the companions for not helping. This led to tension, causing one sailor to leave the table upset.

Description: 02/12/24 1:30am HDA CC: Assistant Beverages operations manager came to sailor services stating that the sailor is intoxicated and that his alcohol rights should be revoked. ABOM, sated that the sailor is a casino player and that he got frustrated for losing his money. ABOM also stated that the sailor was rude towards him.

Above-mentioned Sailor went to the Tune up for the Thermage seminar and arrived just after 11am. At the time Dr. Merita had another sailor at the Tune up. The sailor was advised by another staff member to have a seat and Dr. Merita will be with him shortly. He proceeded to shout at the staff member, asking her where the champagne was. She let him know there wast  champagne and he got even more upset. 
When Dr. Merita came out he started by asking her where the champagne was and no one offered him champagne. She apologized to the sailor and he shouted at her saying he dint want to be here, he just wants the champagne. He said it stated on the app that champagne will be served and was once again polity told, we do not offer champagne at the seminar. 

-We do not offer champagne at our seminars and we're also unsure of why the sailor thinks we offer it. I have gone and checked the description of the seminar and it does not say anything about us offering any champagne. 
The sailor left and said he wanted to speak to the manager as he wants to be compensated. I have tried contacting the sailor twice but there was no answer.
Latest_Comment: HDA SB - Sailor approached the desk, stating that no one had reached to him, he is super upset about the way the crew member acted towards him, he also complained about the gut health program, he said that the person given the lecture, did not make any point, he was just going in circles over the subject but no given any solutions, as per sailor he is a very smart person and he felt insulted by the CM given the lecture, because he was treating everyone like they were stupid.// HDA listened carefully, apologized for the inconvenience caused, and called Spa manager. She came to the desk and spoke with sailor.
Resolution_Details: 02/16/24 10:10 HDM sailors disembarked 2024-02-16 10:02:14

Description: Sailors with a 12:15 reservations, joined us at 11:45 at the Wake. During first approach, order was taken and sailors waited up to 20 minutes for their Oysters and starters, due to handover between servers, server who was leaving didnt do a proper handover and sailors waited long time. ARM Oliver immediately apologized for the inconvenience and along with the new server taking care of them, the starters plus other requests were served right away. After quality check, sailor pointed out a long hair stuck to the salad, Oliver once again approached and apologized once again for the misfortune and told the sailors he was going to personally look after them. Executive Chef was informed and when the mains were fired, Oliver along with Executive Chef, verified that food was perfect. Oliver then served the sailors personally, 2 hanger steaks medium and poached egg, to Oliver's surprise sailor said that they ordered a hanger steak and a filet mignon. The order was wrongly placed, we offered one filet mignon but sailor, disappointed, decided not to wait and eat the hanger steak instead.
Latest_Comment: Oliver once again apologizing for the inconvenience and trying to make it up to them, complimented the oysters and sailors were happy with the attention, but as they left they approached Oliver and tetiana mentioning how unsatisfied they were with service due to the amount of mistakes.
Resolution_Details: Tetiana invited them for dinner and sailors mentioned they have a reservation on wednesday although after their experience they were considering cancelling it and dine elsewhere but we convince them to join us to make it up. they will be dinning early for a nice window table will be offered and we mentioned once again that we will look after them in order to make sure they have a perfect dinner with us.

Description: HDA Virgil 4:32PM 2.12- sailor approached ss desk to raise a complain about recent spa experience. On embarkation day sailor went to the spa to book treatment for himself and his mother. Description:
Q: Welcome Sailor! How did you find coming aboard?, A: 4

Q: Not finished? Tell us everything!, A: The only thing that affected our first impression was the early luggage drop off process. We flew in early morning, long before our embarkation time an we knew we could leave our luggage at the terminal which is nice. Though the person who handled this process upon our arrival wasn't friendly or nice at all, he was pushing about tips that he said we can only pay in cash and only right now, which wasn't expected at all. He also seemed to be unhappy or I would say even upset with the five dollar bill I happened to have. I did feel uneasy leaving my suitcases with him
Resolution_Details: V log is for documenting purposes and comments were passed to the relevant department

Marina was very thankful appreciating the quick follow up from the management. Marina stated that her first cruise been great so far and this issue won't affect her experience. SE delivery charges has been waived as well which Marina appreciate a lot. We will follow up with Sailors during dinner and ensure a great service experience will be provided.

Description:
Sailor had reservation tonight 02/13 at 6.15 PM, RS had just set them down when the sailor decided to get up and leave, RS immediately informed RM which followed the sailor the in "The Galley", RM manage to approached them and asked them if there was any problem with our venue. Mister Ladislas started almost to scream saying " how is possible to have a relaxing dinner with all this load music and people that are screaming, this is the worst cruise I have been on, I did 100 cruises and this is just terrible, everything is terrible, there is a line for everything, is hard to get a reservation, the food is terrible, the mattress is like a futon, the show were terrible, everything is so loud, I want to get off the ship now". 
RM allow the sailor to express his frustration and then tried to calm him down, RM asked them if she could help with another reservation to save the night. Sailors express the desire to dine in Extra Virgin and RM contacted immediately EV RM, which promptly accepted the reservation, RM escorted the sailor all the way to EV and kept talking to them to have a better understanding of their experience.
Sailor keep stating that is not enjoying, but very appreciated the help, they were set on a nice and quite table in EV. RM and RS in EV were informed, also QSM and ROM were updated on the situation right away.
Latest_Comment: HDA Virgil 4:56PM 2.14- called sailors cabin to see if he can meet up with quick services manager. Sailor agreed and informed me that he will pass by ss in the next 30minutes. QSM have been informed about this.
Resolution_Details: On 02/14/2024 @16:15 QSM Hamed met with Sailors by SS to give an ear and assist. Sailors really provided us with constructive feedback. Sailors stated that Gunbae crew were noisy, the staff was encouraging the screaming and noise, Sailors prefer to be aware in advance that Gunbea is a loud Restaurant. Sailors would  like a relaxing dinner. Sailors also mentioned that they enjoyed the Dinner at Extra Virgin and appreciated RM Gaia escorting them there when they wanted to leave Gunbea. Sailors stated that they have experienced great time in other venues like The Galley and Pizza Place stating it's much better than other cruises, you have always available tables, as well he is impressed with the lounges at the dock. Sailors also mentioned that they did enjoy Test Kitchen experience and have shared the same with their friends at home. Toward the end of the conversation Sailors pointed out that Mattresses in the room are hard and not comfortable. Mr. Ladislas also requested to have more signs to direct them around the ship. Ladislas and Charlotte appreciated the time and extra attention that has been given from the management. QSM arranged dinner for them in the Pink Agave  Restaurant with a quiet table as they requested, Dinner was closely monitored by the team which Sailors appreciated a lot. Great dining experience has been provided and Sailors left extremely happy.

Resolution_Details: Restaurant supervisor apologized for the inconvenience.

Description:
Q: How would you rate the overall Virgin Voyages Experience so far?, A: 2
Q: Tell us everything!, A: I didn't get to purchase the bar tab bc I'd issues with the online service. I couldn't call bc the phone lines kept saying the hours of operations and then it would hang up. The room is so small. My fiancé and I are not the slimmest people around, so trying to maneuver in this room is a challenge. Try to walk to the other side to look out of the window and not knock the TV off the wall is difficult. All the bars charge different prices and we've only found 1 that sales dos equis. That's my fiancé favorite beer, so we're settling for other things to keep from having to walk from all over to this one bar that has the dos equis. The staff is good though.
Latest_Comment: 02/14/24 11:21 HDM attempted to call however there was no response
Resolution_Details: 02/15/24 16:05 HDM sailors are non responsive // nothing further unless sailors approach

Description: I asked for one drink and two water.  I received two drinks witch I thought it was for another person and one water    But was changed for Got charged for two drinks cash instead of ship credit
Resolution_Details: Ahoy sailor, We apologize for your experience in The Dock bar on embarkations day. While we always try to ensure that orders are executed correctly sometimes mistakes do happen and in this case your accidentally received your order in reverse - 2 drinks and one water instead of 2 water and 1 drink. We have spoken to our crew member and she was a little busy assisting multiple sailors at the time. We hope this experience did not negatively impact your voyage and we have refunded this whole check on your account including the drink that was ordered as a gesture of goodwill. We apologize again for falling short of your expectations and if there are any further issues with bar service please feel free to contact myself or the beverage management team through our Help Desk Associates. Regards, Conor O'Malley, Beverage Operations Manager

Description: 02/13/2024 /CLO Daria / Sailors joined the ship on 13th of February after missing the boarding time in Miami, ML on 11th of February.
Latest_Comment: Sailors stated that they missed the ship in Miami due to the bridge that leads to the terminal being closed. Sailors said that they could not find a different passage and they lost time finding the way to get the terminal. They got to the terminal at 7:15 pm and the doors were already closed. sailors claimed that the vessel was still docked at 6:30 pm and they felt like it was unfair that they were not able to embark at 5:15. They also felt like they should have been notified by Virgin that the bridge leading to the terminal is closed. CLO empathized and apologized for their experience having to travel all the way to Cozumel to make it onboard.  CLO explained the whole process of departure and why they were not able to join at the time of their arrival. CLO also explained to the sailors that we are not able to compensate them for missing the ship onboard as it took place before their joining, however, she will be more than happy to assist them with making their voyage better onboard. CLO offered the sailors a complimentary upgrade and a Thermal Spa Pass after running it through the SSM. Sailors were very happy with this offer and thanked CLO for all the help. Sailors were moved from 12190M to 10214A and Spa Pass was organized for them. CLO also offered to assist them with dining and show reservations as their bookings were cancelled after they did not join in Miami. CLO booked the requested dinners and show for the sailors. and provided them with a solution letter with the contacts.
Resolution_Details: Sailors were upgraded complimentary and were given Thermal Spa passes.

Description: Mr. Kappes was playing on the Dice table. A bar server approach him to ask him if he needed a drink, but in that moment he happened to be throwing the Dice and he "Seven out". Mr. Kappes expressed his dissatisfaction on an aggressive manner. The Assistant Casino Manager that happened to be supervising the table was rolling the bets and did not see what happened and asked Mr. Kappes if he was OK as he heard his frustration. He mentioned he did not like the way of bar servers approaching him as he is rolling the dice.

Description: HDA Virgil 5:49PM 2.14- sailor approached SS desk quite upset about the recent SPA experience. I sat down with the sailor and assured sailor that I will do my best to get this taking care of. Sailor explained to me that they went to the SPA originally to enquire about different treatments, which they were informed that the massage treatments include thermal spa pass. Sailor reserved 2 massages for them expecting to receive thermal spa access after the treatment, which they were informed that it is not the case. Sailor felt that they were miss informed by the spa crew about this and even when they raised their concern, noone helped them to get this resolved. I apologized to the sailors about their experience, assuring them that our number one priority is to make sure that they have an epic time with us. I spoke with HDM and we came to conclusion to offer sailors thermal SPA passes for tomorrow as the SPA was full. I went out and communicated this to sailors assuring them that all of the feedback provided to me will be documented for further improvements. Sailor was very thankful and happy that the resolution for this has finally been offered. Email sent to the SPA to book both sailors at 6PM tomorrow for the thermal spa.
Latest_Comment: Sailors had booked the service with myself (Carmen) and there was never a mention of the thermal access along with their service. They had spoken to my assistant, Sherieka, after the service and told her that i had said that it was included. She came to get me and i personally spoke with the sailors before  they left the spa. When they were speaking to me they had changed what they said to Sherieka and then said they had spoke to someone else, when i know i was the one who booked it. Sailor has been scheduled for 6pm as stated in the above IM. I will reassure the sailor once again when they come in this evening and ensure they have an epic experience.
Resolution_Details: HDA Virgil 5:49PM 2.14- sailor approached SS desk quite upset about the recent SPA experience. I sat down with the sailor and assured sailor that I will do my best to get this taking care of. Sailor felt that they were miss informed by the spa crew about this and even when they raised their concern, noone helped them to get this resolved. I apologized to the sailors about their experience, assuring them that our number one priority is to make sure that they have an epic time with us. I spoke with HDM and we came to conclusion to offer sailors thermal SPA passes for tomorrow as the SPA was full. I went out and communicated this to sailors assuring them that all of the feedback provided to me will be documented for further improvements. Sailor was very thankful and happy that the resolution for this has finally been offered. Email sent to the SPA to book both sailors at 6PM tomorrow for the thermal spa.

Description: Sailors came for brunch to the wake and sailor decided to skip appetizer and order only main dish . Other group 5more sailors order appetizers and they request to have all meal together, however, genteleman ordered French toast  before appetizers. Sailor were upset and request to void his and his wife Bottomless mimosa as apology.
Resolution_Details:
Rm Tetiana approached table and apologized to the sailors for misunderstanding and informed that she will check with chef and to make sure it will never happen again, but sailors commented that he wants compensation and his day already start with wrong side, sailors were rude . RM Tetiana apologize again and as apology offer to the sailors to void bottomless and due that they have 2 drinks at this moment each they will be charged only for 1 glass of mimosa as complimentary and other can be individual charge. 

Sailors said that it fair enough and accept decision and happy with resolution . Bottomless brunch was voided and 2 drink was charged on company account , 2 mimosa on sailors account.

Description: 2/14/24 HDA CANSU - Sailor approached to desk and told that he was unaware about the bar tab is non-refundable while booking the cruise and Sailor has $372.88 in his account. Sailor told that do not want to be rude but this is ridiculously scamming.
Latest_Comment: 2/14/24 20:58 HDA CANSU - Sailor informed that we can convert the bar tab for $250. Sailor replied: "hank you for your effort but I think my concern is that my friend did all of the bookings for the whole trip, and I understand you say it’s non refundable, he didn’t understand, and I definitely never had a chance to understand as I just sent him the money that he asked me for. Tonight I bought a watch trying to use up my current sailor loot and there is nothing else I could buy. So of the $280 I had to use I spent $200 so because I couldn’t do that trip you’d only have to refund me $80 or so dollars. As for the rest of the money I would feel very “ripped off” if I couldn’t get my money back. My experience has been extremely good on this ship (I have loved it) but I truly had no idea I wouldn’t get my unused money back. I will keep trying to use the bar tab until the trip is over but I fully expect my money back at the end:)"
Resolution_Details: 02/16/24 10:35 HDM sailors disembarked 2024-02-16 10:30:00

Description: 2/14/24 HDA CANSU- Sailor approached to desk and told that tonight is the 20th anniversary of the Sailors and they had the terrible experience in EV. The sailor expressed frustration with the service at EV, citing a 25-minute wait for the main course due to a lost ticket order. Subsequently, the sailor went to sailor services to reinforce their complaint. The PA Restaurant Manager was informed, who committed to follow up the next day in the restaurant.

Description: Sailor came to check-in at 6:30pm while her reservation was at 7:00pm. Her reservation was only for 1 but wanted to be accommodated as party of 3. RS informed the sailor that at the moment, the venue is fully booked which makes it not possible to accommodate 3. RS apologized to the sailor and offered to make it for 2. However, the sailor was rude and started telling "I don't care. It happened also last night in Pink Agave. They told me they are full but there are empty tables. Everything was a lie. I waited there until they gave me table." RS explained that the venue is full and it might take time to wait but sailor insisted that she will wait and wanted to talk to the manager. RS accommodated the sailor's request immediately. RM spoke to the sailor and she repeated what she wanted to happen to RM. RM explained the same situation to the sailor but she started to get rude again to RM and took a photo of the name badge, making it obvious that she's giving a threat to complain if she will not be accommodated. Sailor made the other sailors waiting in the line to feel upset because of her behavior.
Latest_Comment: Sailors from Cabin 10342z had to wait for a table due to the sailor's inappropriate behavior.
Resolution_Details: RM apologized again to the sailor and informed the sailor that she is really willing to wait, she can sit in the lounge, but it might take time. Sailor agreed and sat in the lounge. However, sailor called her two friends to join her, putting the RM in a difficult situation. RM offered to sit the sailors to avoid more complications.

Description: Sailor mentioned in the survey that, "Found a vape pen charging in our wall when we arrived. Also, seems like our bathroom was not cleaned thoroughly."
Latest_Comment: DM met and apologized to the sailors in the cabin for any inconvenience caused. The sailors informed DM that a USB charger for the vapor was left on the socket behind the leather chair, but it did not belong to them. They did not want to be charged any penalty for smoking. DM also noticed a brown stain on the shower holder. The sailors thought it was rust, but DM explained that it was glue used to fix the faucet properly on the wall, and it came out slightly. ACH removed the stain and sanitized the shower area. After the first day, everything was excellent for the sailors. They found the service of the crew amazing and their cabin very comfortable for the duration of their stay. Sailor thanked for following up on their feedback.
Resolution_Details: A bottle of bubbles was delivered to the cabin as a gesture of apology for the inconvenience caused.

Description:
Q: How was your bar experience?, A: 1
Q: Knowledge of the crew?, A: 3
Q: Service?, A: 1
Q: Menu choices?, A: 4
Q: Not finished? Tell us everything!, A: I waited a ridiculously long time to get served at the beach bar. Once I did get someone to help me, the drinks I wanted had run out. The server Chand was his name said oh I’m sorry for the long wait, and also for the fact nothing I wanted was available. So I chose a different drink to which he said since I waited so long and had to change drinks he would “take care of me”. I asked for a Malibu and pineapple juice which he made and when I checked my bill later on, he charged me for a double!!! I just wanted my drink. I didn’t ask for anything extra. Especially not the extra charge. This whole incident including the double charge and the no stock of beverages, made me very disappointed. Do better Virgin.
Resolution_Details: Ahoy! Sorry we made you wait today at Bimini - your drinks were on us and were refunded.  Hopefully this didnt ruin your experience.  Shane

Description:
Q: How would you rate the overall Virgin Voyages Experience so far?, A: 1
Q: Tell us everything!, A: The bed has a thin, unsupportive mattress over a metal frame. It’s really a flimsy futon. Painfully uncomfortable. There is FAR too much noise on the ship, including FABRICATED, ENCOURAGED noise at the Korean restaurant. Performances are deafening. Entertainment venues are painfully loud and vastly overcrowded because the venues are too small. There are massive lines to get on the ship, to book dinners, etc. We’ve been on over a hundred cruises and this was by far the worst. For the first time in our cruising careers, we’re happy to see the cruise end.
Resolution_Details: V log is for documenting purposes and comments were passed to the relevant department

Description: 02/15/24 12am HDA CC: Sailor sent an SQ message "Today I visited the sip lounge to enjoy their delightful afternoon tea. I waited patiently for about 20 minutes, but unfortunately, the servers seemed to be assisting other customers who arrived after us. My cabin mate and I were still waiting for someone to come and take our order. We received assistance only after I had to flag down a server. As we were finally served, we couldn't help but notice that others who arrived after us were helped immediately. I must confess that I experienced a certain emotional response. On other occasions, when we visited the sip lounge, Kenneth was the one who promptly assisted us. I'm uncertain about the necessity of training your staff to be more attentive to all customers (which is the impression I got), but it did leave a negative impression and made me have a negative experience at the sip lounge. My experience at the sip lounge would have been negative if it weren't for Kenneth's presence during my previous visits. Thank you Kenneth for ensuring that my time at the sip lounge was enjoyable."// "In addition, if I don't see Kenneth we will not be stopping at the sip lounge."
Resolution_Details: Ahoy sailor, we apologize that we have not met your expectations of our service standards and that by this account our team feel short. We will investigate why this issue occurred to help us improve our operation. We have refunded the charge for your afternoon tea as a gesture of goodwill due to these shortcomings. My Assistant Bar Manager did try to reach you last night to discuss the matter further but was unable to reach you.  If you would like to discuss this matter further please reach out to myself or any of the bar management team this morning through our Sailor Services Help Desk. Regards, Conor O'Malley, Beverage Operations Manager.

Description: 02/15/24 12:11 am / BK 1090790 / Sailor is claiming to have the Seriously Suite as he offer the big amount in the "Sale" for it. (See the photo attached) due this sailor is  asking the offer didn't go through, he was traveling when he supposed to received a notification and this didn't happened. Also he said he had a phone call with the team, and the person advised to sailor right after he provided the information the charge will be automatically on his Credit Card. / Solutions update: Ahoy Berenice! The sailors upgrade offer was never accepted. He would have received an email if it would have accepted and his card that he put on file for the bid would have been charged. If we do not upgrade a sailor we don't charge the card nor send an email. / Ahoy @Berenice Velazco Ximello for BK# 1090790: our Level Upgrade program is a bid system. Sailor makes an offer and it may or may not be accepted. It is not a guaranteed upgrade. Sailors do have the option pre-voyage based on availability to upgrade their cabin category and pay current prices to have their preferred cabin confirmed and not depend on the bid. I hope this helps.
Latest_Comment: 2/15/24 2:17pm / Solutions letter was provided.
Resolution_Details: No action is required until Sailor approached the desk.

Description: Air Conditioning

02/16/2024 HDA JKG. Sailor came to desk requesting to please have her breast milk stored as her fridge seems to not be cool enough. She would also like to freeze 5 or  ice packs, she would like to have these frozen before she leaves the ship on disembarkation. Shore side informed the sailor that onboard she can request and we will assist. HDA informed the sailor that we will request for house keeping to take a look at the fridge to make sure its working and will follow up regarding the milk to be stored in the medical. HDA Informed the sailor that we do not offer breast milk storage. HDA Called medical to reconfirm the breast milk storage. Medical confirmed that this is something we cannot offer.
Latest_Comment: HDM OM: The sailor approached the desk requesting to speak to a manager. HDM spoke to the sailor who was extremely unhappy about the "fridge" in the cabin not being adjusted to the temperature suitable for keeping the milk in the good condition. HDM double checked with the medical who confirmed that they are not able to keep milk in their fridges, however, they may provide extra coolers with ice to keep milk cold. The sailor accepted the offer. After a while sailor came back to ask to speak to a manager again. The sailor wanted to file a formal complaint as the nurse told that it`s not guaranteed that the milk will not be spoiled even if to keep it with extra coolers. HDM apologized for their experience and assured that this information will be addressed to the shoreside team. HDM offered a solutions letter to the sailor , so she could contact the shoreside after the voyage is over. The sailor appreciated the help.
Resolution_Details: 02/17 15:00 HDM OM: HDM called the sailor and informed that the cooler`s temperature in the cabin is approx 40 degrees Fahrenheit. As per SOP, this temperature is enough to keep the breast milk for a short period of time. HDM also informed that with the extra ice given by medical, the chances that the milk will remain fresh are higher. The sailor appreciated the call and assistance. HDM assured that we are always here for them.

Description: Tablet or TV Issue

The sailor while she was playing on UTH due to a loosing hand against our dealer have shouted very intensively  while pointing the dealer too : " go to hell , go to hell ,, do to hell " .  The dealer have stayed quite and kept doing his job.  This have happened under the supervision of the supervisor . 
I Have personally reminded the player to use an appropriate language and to try to respect each others ,  since we are all from different countries certain words can be taken in different ways and result offensive .  She have apologized and said that she didn't mean to offend the dealer personally  and that it will not happen again
Resolution_Details:
The Sailor understood the situation and apologized  and said that she didn't mean anything personal to the dealer .
 Game followed smoothly and the player kept playing on the table  and having fun with her friends

Description:
Mr. Miller came to the Casino Cage and asked if he could have a printed player's card since he does not have a wearable because he was having issues with his cabin - normally used as players card. The Assistant Casino Manager approach Mr. Miller and told him that he would have to double check with the Slot Manager since this is an unusual request.
After a discussion to find the best solution for this request, both the Assistant Casino Manager and Slot Manager spoke with Mr. Miller to explain him that unfortunately there is no option to print a players card; however, they can monitor his play and they could estimate they points and add them to his account after he is done playing. Mr. Miller was happy with the resolution and thank both Managers. After the resolution of his request, Mr. Miller drop his frustration in regards to the overall experience onboard, since boarding he has struggled with his luggage, cabin ('bad smell') and appliances not working on his cabin (TV). The Assistant Casino Manager and Slot Manager apologize and empathize with Mr. Miller who requested if he could speak with someone 'as close as the Captain' as he is not having a good time and is just a bad experience after another. The Assistant Casino Manager told Mr. Miller that he would contact the Sailor Services team and a Manager will be in contact with him. He was happy with this and he is expecting a follow-up on his case.
Resolution_Details: 02/17 HDM OM: The case is duplicated SC-35961803982346934

Description: Mr. Green, Tyler was playing at the Single Deck Blackjack table, during one of the hands, he expressed his dissatisfaction with the rule that states 'No double down after splitting'. His frustration escalated and became verbal abusive toward the dealer and the Assistant Casino Manager who was supervising the table. Mr. Tyler used obscene gestures and foul language directed at the staff when asked to cash out his chips.
Resolution_Details: The Assistant Casino Manager spoke with Mr. Green about his conduct, emphasizing the inappropriate language and informed him that due to his aggressive behavior he would be asked stop playing, inviting him to cash out his chips at the Casino's Cage. Mr. Green attempted to play on another table, but the Assistant Casino Manager reiterated that he was not allowed to play for the remainder of the night. Mr. Green's response was aggressive and vulgar; he threatened to make a complaint and he stated that he would never cruise with Virgin Voyages again. The Assistant Casino Manager explained the conduct policy in place for all sailor, stating that aggressive behavior was unacceptable and would not be permitted. Despite the efforts to explain the sailor general conduct policy  and the reasons behind he was stopped from gambling, Mr. Green continued using foul language towards the Assistant Casino Manager and left the casino.

Description:
02/16/24 @ 18:40 ASTM Tobyn: Ahoy Team!

I had Sailor Lisa approach the desk to express her frustration. Sailor explained that she had originally booked for herself and a group of 26 sailors on Brilliant Lady but received a mail saying that because the ship is not ready they will rebook them on scarlet, many of her sailors declined to sailor onboard Scarlet only leaving 14 sailors/8 cabins and as a result in this these cabins received more +-$800 in sailor loot.

Please see below cabins booked:
12298Z / BK#629759 - Lisa Ann Cimaroli & Matthew Szostek (Booked
11026Z / BK#629776 - Rachel Kidder & Jeremy White
11074Z / BK#629771 - Chara Hybertson & Christopher Ray
11082Z / BK# 629770 - Cameron Murphy & Mandy Wittkopp
12014A / BK# 629763 - Jason Hall & Rachel Mcgough Hall
12058Z / BK# 629757 - Timothy Yockey
12290A / BK# 629753 - Connor Boneham
12294Z / BK# 629758 - Manuel Aguilar & Viktoriia Aguilar

She explained that she was told that CC details need to be provided so that their tours can be "held" in order to reserve their shore things to ensure availability and once they arrive onboard they can your their SL to rebook the shore things, She requested to have the tours cancelled onboard and rebooked using their sailor loot since it was given due to "Virgin fault" for cancelling their trip on Brilliant. I advised her that unfortunately we cannot cancel and refund pre booked tours and rebook them using their sailor loot.

Lisa is not happy with the result as she booked and paid for the voyage for all of them and does not want the tours to be charged on their CC and were advised that it would not be.
Latest_Comment: 02/19/24 @ 09:05 ASTM Tobyn: ASTM tried contacting sailor to their cabin but no response. Following message sent on SQ : " Ahoy Lisa! This Tobyn, Assistant Shore Things manager. Would you be so kind to stop by chart table on deck 7 between 10:00am-12:30pm or 4pm-6pm today for a chart please."
Resolution_Details: 02/20/24 ASTM Tobyn: Following message sent to sailor on SQ" Ahoy Lisa! This is Tobyn, Assistant Shore Things Manager again, I have tried to contact you in your cabin Multiple times today but you must to enjoy the beautiful Bimini island. Just to get back to you regarding the rebooking of you Shore Things using your Sailor loot, I have been in contact with our Shoreside Team and have tried my best to assist you wit this. As per Our Shoreside Team your Sailor loot can only be used for onboard purpose and there pre booked shore things cannot be refunded and rebooked using sailor loot. My apologize for all the inconvenience caused. If you do have any other inquires please to contact your First Mate post voyage. I do hope that you enjoyed your voyage with us. Have a epic last evening onboard the beautiful Scalet Lady."

Description: sailor mentioned in the survey, "I wish the glam station had better lighting and also why aren’t there music channels on the tv?"
Latest_Comment:
The DM met with the sailor and discussed the recent survey that had been conducted. According to the sailor, they were looking for more brightness in the makeup area. The DM increased the intensity of the light using a tablet, and the sailor remarked that it was better than before. 

Regarding music channels, the DM explained that unfortunately, there were limited channels available on board. However, there were plenty of preloaded movies that were free to watch, unlike on other ships where payment is required. 

The sailor understood and thanked the DM for valuing their feedback. The Deck Manager also expressed gratitude for the sailor completing the survey.
Resolution_Details: no further assistance needed at this moment

Description:
2/18/2024 HDA CANSU - Sailor sent message through SQ: Hi, I’d like to speak to someone about a problem I’m having! Yes, we’re out at the moment! I’ve spoken to a few crew members about this, I’m looking for a quiet spot in the shade and it appears that no one can help me. the only place that is quiet and shaded is Richard’s Rooftop, but no one can help with access. this is the third day it’s been loud and too sunny for me to sit outside in peace, it’s very disappointing. HDA Cansu replied: "Ahoy Jenna, the most quiet deck is deck 17, The Perch, back of the ship. I am sure that you can find peace in there. Sailor replied : "No unfortunately both the perch and deck 17 are in full sun. I’ve checked both the back and front of the ship, we’re currently at The Dock and the music is blaring from the bar AND the shore. Is it possible to upgrade to get access to the quiet Richard’s Rooftop? My friends have sailed with virgin before and have been given influencer access to it, is that an option? HDA Cansu replied: " To having the access for the Richards Rooftop, you should have a Rockstar Cabin booked or have a VIP status that we can provide service in there. Otherwise we do not have an option to upgrade your on board status with the access. Sailor Jenna asked: "What is the criteria for VIP status. HDA replied: "For example, Sailors who are working collaborate with marketing or advertisement. Sailor asked : "Could you provide me with a name and number? HDA replied: "You can find in Virgin Voyages website.Please check > voyageservices.com. Sailor replied: "That doesn’t appear to be an active link, I can’t seem to access it…if you cannot help me, what are my options for disembarking and booking a flight home? We are really unhappy with our experience at this point. HDA replied: For the disembarkation day you can choose your preferred disembarkation time. To do so, please just follow few easy steps on your Sailor App:
Discover ? Book excursion ? Miami Disembarkation Group ? Choose from the available timings .
Debarkation slots are available from 7.30am to 10.30am . For your transportation and booking flight to home, you need to arrange by yourself in your mean time. If you would like to leave the ship today, please inform me about your flight time and what time you would like to disembark, so that we can inform Clearance Officer accordingly. " Sailor replied "Is there someone I can speak to in person? I’m concerned that going back and forth with you will cause me to miss my window of time to leave. HDA said:"Ahoy Jenna, we are all willing to help you. Please let me know about your concerns. " Sailor replied:  did just outline everything above… my concerns are there is nowhere I have access to on this ship that is outside, quiet and shaded. I’ve been provided no options by your team and have explored the entire ship. The only option I can see is Richard’s rooftop but I’ve been told there that is not possible. This is not the experience that was advertised, if there are no options available to me we’d like to know who can help us book travel details home.To be clear, for today. " HDA replied: As we mentioned before, unfortunately we are not providing Sailors booking flight to your home, if you would like to disembark, you need to inform us about your flight details and what time you would like to disembark, so that we can inform Clearance Officer accordingly." Sailor asked : "So you can’t give me any other options?" HDA Berenice replied : "Ahoy Jenna, we can assist you with the process to disembark, all the flight arrangements are on you. Meanwhile kindly allow us to share this with our Clearance officer to verify if there's something specific you need to provide to us. (Like the port fee for disembark just in case is applied on this Port) . May you need additional assistance please let us know or stop by Sailor Services Desk - Deck 5 at your convenience time. "
Latest_Comment: 02/18/24 @16:20 HDA Barbara: Sailor passed by SS her wearable was already changed to black ones she asked for cards to open RRT. HDA asked SSM to create two cards as per message sent to Help Desk Workchat by HDM " 9126Z please exchange the wearables to black and provide the key cards when the sailors stop by. Thank you" // The two cards were given to Sailor Jenna
Resolution_Details: 02/19 HDM OM: The sailor appreciated assistance with issuing key cards for RRT.

Description:
18/02/24 12:20pm 
Sailor Katharine messaged her Mrsa asking if she could make her a reservation at The Wake for brunch as she had issues getting inside with the Rs there. Sailor Katharine wrote "I asked if there was room for the 2 of us to sit and have brunch and the Rs just asked if we had a reservation. When I said no she said sorry,no. Polite but very cold. She didn't even check if anything was available or suggest we look in the app or even point us towards the dock or a different food venue. I'm definitely not expecting people to recognize us but the reason we walked down to The Wake was because we saw reservation at 12:30pm available and we didn't think it was a big deal to walk into the restaurant. I would probably have said something even if we was sailing on an inside cabin, Technically she wasn't rude, just unhelpful and unfriendly."

Mrsa managed to get sailors a brunch reservation at The Wake for brunch at 12:45pm herself as she seen there was very much space left. Mrsa informed sailors about their reservation then they proceeded to the venue again.

Description: 02/18/24  @18:00 HDA Barbara Sailor Thomas came to SS to give feedback on the Fricolandia Beach Club, Catamaran, & Lunch excursion. According to sailor the ay to he catamaran was long, 45 mins and the 15min sail was in silence. Sailor was expecting music or some fun time on he boat (As he had experienced on other rides) and was disappointed by the lack of fun activities. After arriving the beach they only spent 15 mins there, and not on the little huts that are shown on the advertisment photos but to the side from there sailor says the photo is a misleading picture about the tour. Once on the island there were no drinks only one cooler no other choice for drinks. The bartender didn't speak English and didn't understand any other orders. Upon arrival the tables weren't even set up they had to wait to be able to sit down and get some food, sailor is upset about all the wait as they only had food in the morning. Noone told the sailor that there is another bar they can go to, only at the end he went to the other bar where he could order a drink finally that he could only drink on his way back to the ship
Latest_Comment: STS Nikos called sailor to relay that his feedback was very helpful & will be used to better our sailor experience in the future, sailor understood & thanked me for the call with no request of compensation, NFA
Resolution_Details: Sailor happy with feedback being passed on

Description: 02/18/2024/ 6pm/HDA Irina/ Sailor send feedback on SQ: The Draught House and all the rest of the bars are OUT of IPA’s and the wider selection of beers advertised. We’re only halfway thru the cruise and OUT. This is not acceptable and does not reflect well on Virgin Voyages. 5 min ago the Draught House had 3 taps still open, said the rest was out
Latest_Comment: 02/18/2024/ 7:00 pm /HDA Irina/ Sailor sent a message: I could meet with a bar manager, but it doesn’t mean anyone’s going to fly in a shipment to restock this cruise. Your diversity in beer offerings was one of the things that got me excited about coming here. Heineken and lite lagers ain’t it. This is a significant fail, and I’m bummed because it was even foretold on Reddit. I didn’t want to believe it would be true". But did not confirm if he would like to meet a manager.
Resolution_Details: Ahoy sailor, we are very sorry that we have fallen short of your expectations this voyage for our beer offerings. Unfortunately we are having some issues with our suppliers and were unable to source some of our less mainstream beers prior to this voyage.  We are very sorry that this has impacted your experience onboard and while it is of little consolation we have refunded all charges for Virgin Craft Beer that were on your account. If you would like to meet to discuss this any further please do not hesitate to reach our to myself or any member of the beverage management team via our Sailor Services help desk. Regards, Conor O'Malley - Beverage Operations Manager.

Description:
Q: How was your entertainment?, A: 2

Description: Feb 17th at 21:00 RSM received a call from SS informing Sailor Shakella would like to speak with RSM. While RSM was on the way, Sailor reported to HDA that she needed help in the Groupie deck 7 as they had reservations but the room was occupied. HDA sent a message to Entertainment group asking for assistance. RSM proceeded to Groupie and met with the Sailor. She explaine to RSM that Sailors from 13011A had requested to be booked for two hours in a row and their RSA confirmed. However, when the Sailors arrived the first reservation (8pm to 9pm) was stroke by other Sailors who put their own names and took usage of the Purple Room. Sailor Shakella (travel agent) was then contacted by them to solve the situation. She approached the Sailors to explain that 13011A was booked for the room, and as the Pink Room was available, she invited them to enjoy the other room. Sailors accepeted and all worked well, however, Shakella shared her frustration as she is a Rockstar on vacation and should not be working. This took her time of enjoyment. RSM extended apologies to the Sailor and advised her he came to check on them as fast as possible, but she had "fixed" the situation before. Sailor appreciated RSM coming over to check on them. RSM invited the Sailors for some drinks but she refused as she was going to bed. Treat Yourself Menu to be offered.
Latest_Comment: RSM Gabriel Feb 19th $45 + $15 comped from her account from Squid Ink services.
Resolution_Details: 02/18/2024 20:00 RSA LH: RSA spoke to both sailors in 13011A and 14253Z. Allgood, nothing further.

Description: Sailors reported that they received a rude interaction with a bartender in Aquatic Bar and wished to speak to a manager. Valentina (Sommelier) who is the supervisor onboard during the Bimini operation went to meet the sailors who advised the bartender in Aquatic had been rude. Valentina advised the sailors that it was very out of character with the bartender and that they had been under a lot of pressure and would not intentionally be rude to a sailor. Sailors accepted this noting that it had been quite busy. Valentina assured the sailors it would be followed up with the crew member.
Latest_Comment: I followed up with the crew member (Laras). Laras explained that she was very busy and the sailors were undecided about what they wanted to drink and two requests they had were not onboard. She was trying to stay engaged with the sailors while serving other sailors to not have a line build-up since she was alone due to all the other crew being on the island. Laras said that at one point she turned to another sailor to confirm an order and when she turned back Scott had moved away from the counter and Stephanie turned and addressed the crew member quite rudely saying "Thank You" but in a loud and sarcastic tone which made Laras feel upset as she had been trying to assist everyone by herself.
Resolution_Details: Sailors seem content with Valentina's follow up however logging the crew members' side of this interaction in case of further escalation as the crew member was indeed very busy when we checked sales for the period.

Description: 2/20/24 HDA Adeliya - Sailor via SQ "Hi I have a concern about an interaction I had at the Bimini beach club today. I went to the bar to get a drink for my girlfriend and the bartender was very rude to me. The bartender looked at me and asked what I wanted, once I asked for what I wanted he looked and pointed at me and said “no”. Then started serving others around me. I felt (as a woman who is masculine presenting with top surgery) excluded due to my appearance although I thought virgin was made for all. I am disappointed in this experience and was expecting better. HDA apologized and offered arrange meeting Sailor replied " That is not needed from my end. I just wanted to reassure that this behavior will not be replicated in the future. I am glad my concern was heard. I appreciate you responding, thank you."
Resolution_Details: Ahoy sailors, we are very sorry for this incident and we will be following up with the bartender and our entire team to ensure an incident like this does not occur again. We are as you said accepting of every individual and one of our 5 foundations accept each and every person (crew or sailor) as they are. It is deeply disappointing to hear that some of our team may not be living by these foundations. We hope this did not negatively impact your view of Virgin Voyages and rest assured that issues such as this are not tolerated and will not arise in the future. Regards, Conor O'Malley - Beverage Operations Manager.
